   "github_updated_at": "2020-09-15T20:21:09Z",
   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\nSerializing connection properties takes too much when there is no inheritance applied. I want to propose an approach that if no inheritance is applied, nothing will be serialized to connection xml. That way we can gain some file size and cpu usage IMHO.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\n<!--- If you're describing a bug, tell us what should happen -->\r\n<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->\r\nWhen ...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-20",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Feature request from core maintainer to skip serializing default/inherited connection properties, reducing XML file size and improving save performance"
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [],
   "comments_cursor": "2020-09-15T20:21:09Z",
   "unread_comments": 0,
   "needs_action": false,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): Feature request from core maintainer to skip serializing default/inherited connection properties, reducing XML file size and improving save performance\nApproach: In XmlConnectionNodeSerializer28, compare each property against DefaultConnectionInfo defaults and the inheritance flags â€” only emit XML attributes whose values differ from the default when inheritance is not enabled for that property. This preserves backward compatibility (reader already handles missing attributes as defaults) while significantly reducing file size for users with many connections using default settings."
 }
